original: Behre, Frank Einar, fil. dr, professor, Göteborg, numera Stockholm, f. 2/3/96 i Gbg. G. 45 m. Signe Jacobson. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 14, fil. kand. 19, fil. mag. 20, fil. lic. i eng. 28, i isanskrit m. jämf. -språk-foTskn. 31, fil. dr 34. Res. t. Engl. 20, 21, 27, 32, 34, Tyskl. o. Schweiz 30. Lär. v. Gbgs ensk. hand:gymn. 20-21, v. Gbgs hand:inst. 22-31, 35, 36, 39, v. Filip HoJmqvists hand :inst. 28-33, huv:lär. i eng. v. hand :högsk. i Gbg fr. 32, docent i eng. språk. o. litt. v. Gbgs högsk. fr. 34. Prof. i eng. språk. v. Sthlms högsk. 47. Skr.: The subjunctive in Old Engl. poetry (ak. avh. 34), A Middle Engl. noun lede (38), Middle Engl. hak, a Scand. loan-word (38), Middle Engl. rochine (38), Thomas Castelford’s chronicle. Ed. in parts w. comments (1-2 40), Two Middle Engl. words of Scand. origin (42), Engl. gal(e), gol, goal (45). Redig, tills. m. G. Sten J. A. Af-zelius Eng. hand :korresp. 13 :e o. 14 :e revid. uppl. (42, 45). LVVS.
translated: Behre, Frank Einar, PhD, professor, Gothenburg, presently Stockholm, b. 2/3/96 in Gothenburg. Married to Signe Jacobson in 1945. - Completed secondary school in Gothenburg in 1914, bachelor's degree in 1919, Master of Arts in 1920, licentiate degree in English in 1928, and a doctorate in philosophy in 1934. Traveled to England in 1920, 1921, 1927, 1932, and 1934, and to Germany and Switzerland in 1930. Taught at Gothenburg's private commercial gymnasium from 1920-1921, at Gothenburg's commercial institute from 1922-1931, 1935, and 1936-1939, at Filip Holmqvist's commercial institute from 1928-1933, and as a professor of English at the Handelshögskolan in Gothenburg from 1932. Appointed docent in English language and literature at Gothenburg's university in 1934. Professor of English language at Stockholm's university in 1947. Published works include: The Subjunctive in Old English Poetry (Doctoral thesis, 1934), A Middle English Noun Lede (1938), Middle English Hak, a Scandinavian Loan-word (1938), Middle English Rochine (1938), Thomas Castelford's Chronicle. Ed. in Parts with Comments (1940), Two Middle English Words of Scandinavian Origin (1942), and English Gale, Gol, Goal (1945). Edited, together with G. Sten J. A. Afzelius, English commercial correspondence (13th-14th revised ed., 1942, 1945). LVVS.
